column5: I suppose you are right about making it go to the end but it kinda makes for more of a points racing thing than a race to win thing.Tony would never have made a fuel mileage gamble to win if he was in the chase.Its not all bad,just could use some improvement.91 days till Daytona,wonder how the Toyotas are gonna fare?I like what they have done in the truck series! Go Johnny Benson! Joe
I guess the race is over, Dan is back posting here, lol.

i agree about the short tracks, i say finish it up at bristol, now thats a battle ground!  that way there wouldnt be any coasting through the field.  it was a good season, wish jr. had done a little better, but his day will come, and at least he still beat jeffy boy. jason
down with jimmie up with kahne yaaaa.....dodge rules

Well this is it today guys. Last race of the year and the day that Jimmie Johnson finally wins his title. Or is it? Barring any kind of disaster he should win handily, but anything can happen. I look for Jimmie to run near the front but not to push for the win. And except for a few guys, most drivers will give him plenty of elbow room. I'd hate to be the guy that screws up and takes him out.  Any other predictions?

No predictions, but I finally took your advice and brought a HDTV to my den and got it fired up late Tuesday.  Just as you said, it's great.  So great that I bought the same set for my bedroom Friday.  Racin' at my house will be better than ever today.  I won't be answering my phone during the race.
Oh man Connie. Only one race in HD and then you'll have to wait 3 months to see another one? LOL  Enjoy the race and the TV Bud. You're gonna love it!!

Good on Jimmy if he wins the championship. He's a class act. I'm an psuedo Earnhardt Junior fan (throwback from being a senior fan) but wouldn't have minded seeing Mark Martin win a championship either. Too bad he's got no chance now. They're all lucky "Smoke" didn't make it to the top 10....he's been on fire lately. Already looking forward to Daytona and the start of next season.

#8's championship will probably come, but he has some dues to pay.  I have his jacket and also have Smoke's jacket.  They were gifts.  No family money was spent.  My extra money goes for fishing.  Not to sound like a frontrunner, but gotta like the Lowes car, driver and team today.  Would hate to see anything interfere with a good run for Jimmy.

I only started getting into NASCAR this year after going to watch races at Mosport.  I don't know too much about it but I cheer for Jeff Gordon.  Mostly cuz when I ask my son how much he loves his old man he says  "I love you 24 daddy"

Well Dan It,s has been a great racing season. Although it would be nice to se JR win it  ,Im thinking it is really a 2 car race  .Not to happy to see a rookie making his first start,  especially in this kind of important race.Sure hope he dosent cause some one the over all.
high five to DanC!  yes it been a coupla near misses but Jimmy finally get's 'er done today! 2 years in a row for Chevrolet!  and dont foget, the Grey Cup as well!
Well I hope if Jimmy messes up today he takes matt along with him so that Kevin can get his mitts on the cup. I hate Gordon but have liked Jimmy since he came into the series.
Now the opinions are rolling in. I love it!!! Brian, who is the rookie making his first start today? I must have missed that.
I'm not that exited about the race.I'd love to see Tony win today,too bad Mark Martin is out of it.Keep your eyes on Kasey Kahn today. Joe
Montoya I believe is his name.Open wheel driver.  Here Dan  http://www.nascar.com/2006/news/headlines/...tead/index.html

I will also add,Nascar should never aloud this to happen today of all days.  Dan...........You watching speed? Great reports and old time stories.  News flash,Jimmy has the runs,cant make the race.LOL
Ah yes. Montoya. I did know that after all. Yup I've had speed on all morning. And I can tell you that the only runs that Jimmie has is the run to the championship!!!!
Also dont forget................. If Vickers had not made that huge bone head move,it would be a jr/johnson battle.  Im still peeved about that one.
As well as J.P. Montoya, there are mutterings on the F1 grapevine that Jaques Villeneuve is also looking at NASCAR after being dumped evicted fired by BMW.  Mick
Good news from Larry mac only 91 more days to the 500.
Maybe he will be able to keep these four wheels on the track.LMAO But then again it will be the, crewchief  or pitcrew or cars fault,to bad he SUCKS.
First of all he needs to keep them on the car!
# 17 for me

One of the most anti climactic boring races...ever.I hate the chase format,everyone afraid to near the 10 golden boys makes for some boring races especially on the 1.5 milers.Congrats to JJ and team,they earned it! Joe Give me a short track race most  weeks  and and a Daytona or Talledega once in a while and I'll be happy!
boring indeed  , except the rookie going up in flames  Jimmy gets the job done & in 91 days (only 13 weeks!) he begins Daytona & championship title defences
I'm just guessing here, but did JJ win??? What's NASCAR??? LOL!!!!!!!

But it's much better than having the championship clinched with 3 or 4 races to go Joe. The chase has its faults but it attempts to make the championship up for grabs right to the last minute of the last race. That I find boring. Kudos to Jimmie. He's the man. He deserved it.
